result.execSummary:
The defendant Austin M. Hallock was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Obtain HSED or GED
GFE to maintain fulltime employment, schooling, or combination of the two.

Assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept.
Probation may be transferred to Oneida Co.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

timeConds.notes: To be performed in the amount of not less than 5 hours per month.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Request/Agreement for Modification to Conditions of Probation As Alternative to Revocation of Probation - approved 10/19/15
Includes 14CF87 & 14CF390
Defendant to Judge Jacobson re: time left on probation (includes 14CF87, filed in 14CF390)(stj)
Amended

w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
INCLUDES 14CF87 & 14CF390 (filed in 14CF390)

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 3:29 pm
INCLUDES 14CF87 AND 14CF390. 
State appears by ADA Lance Leonhard; Def appears in person with Atty Andrew Morgan.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. 

State moves to: 
In 14CF87: Ct. 1 (Possess with Intent THC)>>AMEND to Possession of THC pursuant to 961.41(3g)(e). 
                  : Ct. 2 (Possession of THC)>>AMEND to Possess Drug Paraphernalia pursuant to 961.573(1). 
In 14CF390: Ct. 3 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 
State notes it will file an amended information in 14CF87 to reflect changes. 

PLEA: 
In 14CF87: AMENDED Ct. 1 (Possession of THC)>>NO CONTEST. 
                  : AMENDED Ct. 2 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 14CF390: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ)>>NO CONTEST. 
                    : Ct. 2 (Possession of THC)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, def guilty of Cts. 1 and 2 in 14CF87 and Ct. 2 in 14CF390, and defers entry of judgment on Ct. 1 in 14CF390. 
State makes statement. Atty Morgan makes statement. 

COURT ORDERS: In 14CF87: Cts 1 & 2 and In 14CF390: Ct. 2>>SWH for 18 months probation - CONDITIONS: 125 hours community service to be performed in an amount of not less than 5 hours per month; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; obtain HSED or GED; good faith effort to maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2; AODA; payment of court costs. 
                            : In 14CF390: Ct. 1>>DEOJ for 18 months with conditions as outlined in written DEOJ agreement. 
State notes if def successfully completes DEOJ agreement, it will move to dismiss that count. 
COURT finds def is entitled to 3 days jail credit in 14CF87 if revoked. 
COURT finds def eligible to petition for expungement in all after successful completion of probation and if there are no new charges for which probable cause exists. 
COURT authorizes probation being transferred to Oneida County. 
Review of DEOJ set for February 5, 2016 at 10:45 am with Br. 3 JA. 
Adj: 3:54 pm
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 6, 2014 at 03:20 pm.

Clerk Marisa.
